page.title: 06Leisure Activities
page.content: The rowing clubs at Newburn compete each year in the "Heads of the River Regatta" which is held in May or June.Teams come from the Clyde, Edinburgh and Durham to compete.It is worth remembering that the Tyne Keelmen were the first professional rowers in the British Isles. Several local families are members of the Newburn Fishing Club. The Riverside Area has been cleaned up,drained,re-seeded and trees planted.The Country Park and Newburn Riverside Recreation Association,south of Grange Farm,has been built,and formally opened this month:June 1985.Football teams and hockey teams have arranged to use the ground for league matches and for practice sessions.The new boat ramp is apopular feature.A fun-run was held on 5 May ;another is planned for the future.
